original: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5–4 to maintain Title 42 of the U.S. Code, allowing the government to remove persons who have recently been in a country where an infectious disease was present.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United States ruled by a majority of 5 to 4 to keep Title 42 of the U.S. Code, which gives the government the ability to remove people who have been to a country with an infectious disease.

original: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5–4 to maintain Title 42 of the U.S. Code, allowing the government to remove persons who have recently been in a country where an infectious disease was present.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United States voted 5–4 to keep Title 42 of the U.S. Code, which allows the government to remove people who were recently in a country with an infectious disease.

original: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5–4 to maintain Title 42 of the U.S. Code, allowing the government to remove persons who have recently been in a country where an infectious disease was present.
simplified: The Supreme Court voted 5-4 to maintain Title 42. || This allows the government to remove anybody from the United States who has recently visited a country that contains an infectious disease.

original: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5–4 to maintain Title 42 of the U.S. Code, allowing the government to remove persons who have recently been in a country where an infectious disease was present.
simplified: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5-4 that the government can remove a person from the country if they have been in the country and the person has an infectious disease.
comment:
Possible grammatical number change for "persons" to "person"

Possibly it would be better to add an additional substitution annotation for the span "where an infectious disease was present" to "and the person has an infectious disease"

simplified: The Supreme Court of the United States rules 5-4 to maintain Title 42 of the U.S. Code. || This allows the government to remove persons who have recently been in a country where an infectious disease was present.

original: Three members of the endangered Irrawaddy dolphin have died within ten days from each other in Cambodia, prompting an increasingly alarming situation.

original: The 2022 Peruvian political protests correspond to a series of demonstrations called by supporters of the ousted president of Peru, Pedro Castillo, organized by social organizations and indigenous peoples who felt they experienced political disenfranchisement, specifically from the politically left-wing to far left.
simplified: Protests against the 2022 Peruvian government are being held by people who feel they have been shut out of the political process, particularly those who are left-wing to far left. || These demonstrations, which are in support of the ousted Peruvian president, Pedro Castillo, are being organized by social organizations and indigenous populations.

original: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines closes the country's airspace for nearly six hours due to a power outage in its air traffic management center, affecting around 282 commercial flights and over 56,000 passengers.
simplified: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines closed their airspace for six hours due to a power outage in its air traffic center, affecting many commercial flights and passengers.

original: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines closes the country's airspace for nearly six hours due to a power outage in its air traffic management center, affecting around 282 commercial flights and over 56,000 passengers.
simplified: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines closes the country's airspace for nearly six hours due to a power outage in its air traffic management center. || This affects around 282 commercial flights and over 56,000 passengers.

original: Young's first collection of verse, Genius and Fancy, described as "a survey of the London stage," was published in 1791, went into a second edition in 1795, and then was immediately republished in an expanded edition with three times the number of pages as the original.
simplified: Young's first collection of poetry, Genius and Fancy, was described as "a survey of the London stage". || It was published in 1791, went into a second edition in 1795, and then was republished soon after in an expanded edition, which had three times the number of pages as the original.

original: Further important aspects of Fungi in Art relate to preservation of artworks from fungal decay and contamination, as well as initiatives fostering and supporting works able to stimulate dialogues between mycologists (fungal researchers), artists, and society (as for example from the 'Massee Art Grant' by the British Mycological Society or works encouraged and supported by the Fungi Foundation).
simplified: Fungi play an important role in art in terms of preventing fungal decay and contamination of works, as well as creating opportunities for dialogue between mycologists, artists, and the public. || Examples of such projects include the British Mycological Society's 'Massee Art Grant' and the Fungi Foundation's initiatives.
comment:
Possible part of speech structure change for "preservation" to "preventing"

Possible reorder of "artworks" to "works"

original: Further important aspects of Fungi in Art relate to preservation of artworks from fungal decay and contamination, as well as initiatives fostering and supporting works able to stimulate dialogues between mycologists (fungal researchers), artists, and society (as for example from the 'Massee Art Grant' by the British Mycological Society or works encouraged and supported by the Fungi Foundation).
simplified: An important aspect of Fungi in Art is the protection of artwork from fungal damage. || Another important aspect is to make sure mycologists, artists, and society are all on the same page.
comment: Possible grammatical number change for "artworks" to "artwork"

original: Further important aspects of Fungi in Art relate to preservation of artworks from fungal decay and contamination, as well as initiatives fostering and supporting works able to stimulate dialogues between mycologists (fungal researchers), artists, and society (as for example from the 'Massee Art Grant' by the British Mycological Society or works encouraged and supported by the Fungi Foundation).

simplified: Further important aspects of Fungi in Art relate to preservation of artworks from fungal decay and contamination.

original: One of the most important Aghlabid monuments is the Great Mosque of Kairouan, which was completely rebuilt in 836 by the emir Ziyadat Allah I, although various additions and repairs were effected later, which complicate the chronology of its construction.
simplified: The Great Mosque of Kairouan, built by the emir Ziyadat Allah I in 836, is one of the most significant monuments of the Aghlabid era. || Subsequent additions and repairs have complicated the timeline of its construction.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luca Doncic, a point guard for the Dallas Mavericks, scored the first 60-point triple-double in the NBA. || He had 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Maverick’s overtime win against the New York Knicks at home.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks becomes the first player in history to record a triple-double in the National Basketball Association. || Doncic had 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126-121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas, Texas.
comment: Possibly change the span of the substitution to "scores the first 60-point triple-double" to "becomes the first player in history to record a triple-double"

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks scored the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association. || He scored 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in a 126-121 overtime win against the New York Knicks.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luka Doncic, a Slovenian point guard for the Dallas Mavericks, achieved a milestone in the National Basketball Association - the premier men's professional basketball league worldwide. || He scored 60 points, grabbed 21 rebounds and made 10 assists, earning the first 60-point triple-double in the league's history. || The Mavericks won the game 126–121 in overtime against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
comment:
Possible tense structure change for "scores" to "earning"
possible missing insertion for
"grabbed"

Possible part of speech structure change for "126-121 overtime win" to "won the game 126-121 in overtime"

original: The 8mm and 16mm camera props used in the film had real film inside them, with LaBelle being taught how to use the cameras so that what was shot with them on set can be developed for usage in the film, as well as how to cut and splice film stock using the editing machines and film projectors of the time period.
simplified: In the movie, the 8mm and 16mm camera props had real film inside them. || Labelle was taught how to use the cameras and how to edit the film with machines and projectors of the time period. || Thus, the footage he shot on set was able to be used in the movie.
comment: Possible part of speech structure change for "using" to "with"

original: The 8mm and 16mm camera props used in the film had real film inside them, with LaBelle being taught how to use the cameras so that what was shot with them on set can be developed for usage in the film, as well as how to cut and splice film stock using the editing machines and film projectors of the time period.
simplified: The camera props used in the movie had real film. || Labelle was also taught to use the cameras and older machines from the time period to cut and splice film stock. || This was done so that the footage from the prop cameras could be used in the movie.
comment: Perhaps the structure change from "can" to "could" can be replaced with a substitution

original: The sitcom series features the story of Abi (played by Bolu Essien) who secures a job at a top advertising agency in Lagos, although she had a rough start with her superior, she soon got an opportunity to shine at work when she was promoted to become the acting manager after the manager traveled to another branch.
simplified: Abi (played by Bolu Essien) had a difficult beginning at a top Lagos advertising agency. || Despite this, she was promoted to become the temporary manager when the original manager had to go to a different branch.
comment: Possible deletion for "who secures a job"

original: The sitcom series features the story of Abi (played by Bolu Essien) who secures a job at a top advertising agency in Lagos, although she had a rough start with her superior, she soon got an opportunity to shine at work when she was promoted to become the acting manager after the manager traveled to another branch.
simplified: The series features the story of Abi (played by Bolu Essien) who gets a job at a top advertising agency in Lagos. || She soon gets a chance to shine at work when she is promoted to become the acting manager after the manager travels to another branch.

original: In southwestern Ontario, Highway 401 was closed for much of December 23 between London and Tilbury, west of Chatham, due to about 100 vehicles, including numerous tractor trailers, being involved in multiple collisions, while Highway 402 was closed between London and Sarnia because of a 50-vehicle pileup and deteriorating conditions.
simplified: Due to multiple collisions, Highway 401 was closed for much of December 23 between London and Tilbury in southwestern Ontario. || Highway 402 was also closed between London and Sarnia due to a large accident and bad weather.

original: In southwestern Ontario, Highway 401 was closed for much of December 23 between London and Tilbury, west of Chatham, due to about 100 vehicles, including numerous tractor trailers, being involved in multiple collisions, while Highway 402 was closed between London and Sarnia because of a 50-vehicle pileup and deteriorating conditions.
simplified: In southwestern Ontario, Highway 401 was closed for much of December 23 between London and Tilbury, west of Chatham, due to about 100 vehicles, including numerous tractor trailers, being involved in multiple collisions. || Highway 402 was closed between London and Sarnia because of a 50-vehicle pileup and bad conditions.

original: In 2021 the EU imported 83% of its natural gas, but following the invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from Russia have fallen, partly due to the increasing cost, partly because of reductions in supply from Russia, partly through reduction of consumption and partly because of a desire to move away from Russia's Gazprom as a supplier.
simplified: The EU used to import a lot of gas from Russia. || But due to the invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from Russia have fallen. || This is because costs have increased, supply from Russia has gone down, consumption in Europe has decreased, and Europe wants to move away from Russia as a natural gas supplier.
comment: Possible voice structure change for the second sentence.

original: In 2021 the EU imported 83% of its natural gas, but following the invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from Russia have fallen, partly due to the increasing cost, partly because of reductions in supply from Russia, partly through reduction of consumption and partly because of a desire to move away from Russia's Gazprom as a supplier.
simplified: In 2021, the EU imported 83% of its natural gas, mostly from Russia. || However, after Russia invaded Ukraine, gas imports from Russia dropped due to increasing costs and reduced supply, as well as lower consumption and the desire to look for an alternative supplier to Gazprom.
comment:
Possible voice structure change for "the invasion of Ukraine" to "Russia invaded Ukraine

Possibly add more edits specific to each edit that contributed to the structure change

Possible tense structure change from "have fallen" to "dropped"

original: In 2021 the EU imported 83% of its natural gas, but following the invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from Russia have fallen, partly due to the increasing cost, partly because of reductions in supply from Russia, partly through reduction of consumption and partly because of a desire to move away from Russia's Gazprom as a supplier.
simplified: In 2021 the EU imported most of its natural gas, but following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from them have decreased. || This is because of the rising cost, cuts in supply, reduction in consumption, and a wish to no longer be dependent on Gazprom for resources.

original: The Indonesian government raises the volcanic alert status to the highest level after Semeru in East Java erupts, forcing the evacuation of around 2,000 people.

original: Fourteen people are killed, and 24 others are injured when a drunk driver ploughs into crowds at the annual carnival parade in Calabar, Cross River State, Nigeria.

original: Nest was filmed by Hlynur right outside his house over a period of 18 months, with the support and assistance of his three children.

simplified: Hlynur used his three children to help him film Nest outside his house over 18 months.
comment:
Same as before, possibly more annotations related to each specific edit that contributed to the clausal change.
I think the clausal change here is overall good, but I would probably label the insertion of "used" as an inaccuracy due to its tone and how it differs from the original sentence.

original: Nest was filmed by Hlynur right outside his house over a period of 18 months, with the support and assistance of his three children.
simplified: It was filmed by Hlynur right outside his house over a period of 18 months.

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.

comment:
Possible structure change for "announced a deterioration in his health" to "because the previous Pope was very sick"

Possible change the span of the substitution of "Benedict's successor" to just "Benedict's"

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, said on 28 December that his health was getting worse, and he asked for prayers.

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, notified people of a decline in his health on 28 December. || Subsequently, the news of his death was reported and the faithful were asked to pray.

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: The news of his death came after Pope Benedict's successor, Pope Francis, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: Pope Benedict died after Pope Francis announced the decline of his health on 28 December.
comment: Possible Part of Speech structure change for "the news of his death came after" to "died after"

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, reported a decline in his health on December 28th and asked people to pray. || Later, the news of his death was announced.

original: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.
simplified: The news of his death came after Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, announced a deterioration in his health on 28 December and asked the faithful for prayers.

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: The impeachment was a major event during that time. || It was a struggle between the two major U.S. political parties about, for example, the role of Federal courts.
comment: Possible incorrect span for the substitution, should probably be "A high profile affair at the time" to "was a major event during that time"

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties against each other. || The parties had a battle between them over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
comment: Possibly "the parties" to "them" should just be a structure change

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: It was a high-profile affair at the time, because the two major United States political parties of the time, the Democratic Party and the Republican Party, were against each other and wanted to impeach the President.

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: The impeachment created a battle between the two major political parties of the era. || The parties argued over what the role of Federal courts is and other things.

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: An important political event, the impeachment caused conflict between the two major parties in the US at the time. || They disagreed on many issues, including the role of Federal courts.

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: The impeachment caused hostility between the two major political parties during a battle between them over the role of Federal courts and other issues.

original: A high-profile affair at the time, the impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.
simplified: The impeachment was a high-profile affair at the time. || The impeachment pitted the two major United States political parties of the era against each other amid a battle between the parties over, among other things, what the role of Federal courts should look like.

original: Born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan, Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents, with him claiming that his mother had attempted to miscarry by ingesting a quantity of drugs.
simplified: Early life Barnes was born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan. || His parents were both alcoholics and Barnes said that his mother tried to have a baby but she did not have a baby.

original: Born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan, Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents, with him claiming that his mother had attempted to miscarry by ingesting a quantity of drugs.
simplified: Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents. || He claimed his mother wanted to miscarry by taking a quantity of drugs.

original: Born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan, Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents, with him claiming that his mother had attempted to miscarry by ingesting a quantity of drugs.
simplified: He was born in Detroit, Michigan.
comment: Possible just a substitution change for "Barnes" to "He"

original: Born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan, Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents, with him claiming that his mother had attempted to miscarry by ingesting a quantity of drugs.
simplified: Barnes was born in Detroit, Michigan on April 27, 1944. || His alcoholic parents regularly mistreated him, and he claimed that his mother had tried to cause a miscarriage by taking drugs.

original: Born on April 27, 1944, in Detroit, Michigan, Barnes was regularly mistreated by his alcoholic parents, with him claiming that his mother had attempted to miscarry by ingesting a quantity of drugs.
simplified: Barnes was born in Detroit, Michigan on April 27, 1944. || His alcoholic parents mistreated him regularly. || He said his mother had tried to cause a miscarriage by taking drugs.
comment: Possible missing split for annotation

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the U.S. Navy's main base for the early part of the Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: The US Navy lost its base in the Philippines in 1941 and 1942, so Hawaii became the primary base for their island-hopping campaign against the Empire of Japan in the Pacific War.
comment:
Possible part of speech structure change for "Hawaiian" to "Hawaii"

Possible substitution for "US Navy's" to "their" instead of insertion-deletion pair

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: Hawaii became the main US naval base for the early part of the Pacific War against Japan after the loss of the US Naval Base in the Philippines in 1941 and 1942.
comment: Possible part of speech structure change for "Hawaiian" to "Hawaii"

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: After the US Navy lost their base in the Philippines during the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942. || Hawaii became their main base for the early part of the Pacific War against Japan.
comment:
Same as before, possible part of speech structure change for "Hawaiian" to "HawaiI"

Also, possibly "With" to "After" can be a substitution instead of a substitution.

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: During the 1941 and 1942 Philippines campaign, the US Navy lost their naval base in the Philippines and Hawai'i became their primary base for the Pacific War against Japan.
comment: Same as before, possible part of speech structure change from "Hawaiian" to "Hawaii"

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: After the United States lost the Philippines in World War II, Hawaiian became the main base for the United States Navy when they were fighting in the Pacific against the Empire of Japan.
comment: Same as before, "With" to "After" can possibly be a substitution

original: With the loss of US Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the US Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.
simplified: With the loss of U.S. || Naval Base Philippines in the Philippines campaign of 1941 and 1942, Hawaiian became the U.S. Navy's main base for the early part of the island-hopping Pacific War against the Empire of Japan.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, a Slovenian point guard, scored the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association. || He had 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists, helping his team to a 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Luka Doncic, a point guard for the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the NBA. || He gained 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in a 126-121 win over the New York Knicks.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
simplified: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after scoring 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks'126-121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.

original: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic before relocating in 1942 to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
simplified: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic. || In 1942 he moved to Portmeirion, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.

original: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic before relocating in 1942 to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
simplified: Crawshay-Williams was a music critic until 1939. || In 1942 he moved to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and math.

original: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic before relocating in 1942 to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
simplified: Before 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic. || In 1942, he moved to Portmeirion in North Wales and began teaching English, French, and mathematics.
comment: Perhaps "Until" to "Before" can be a substitution

original: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams worked as a music critic before relocating in 1942 to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
simplified: Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams was a music critic. || In 1942 he moved to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
